definition: to make a copy/to plagiarize/to search and seize/to raid/to grab/to go off with/to take a shortcut/to make a turning move/to fold one's arms

sentences.english: This report was read off word for word from the minute book.
sentences.chinese: 這篇報告是從記錄本中逐字逐句抄錄下來的。

sentences.english: She doesn't know I prefer copying out to cutting out.
sentences.chinese: 她不知道與剪貼相比，我更喜歡抄錄。

sentences.english: Have someone scribe the stories or videotape the event.
sentences.chinese: 叫其他人把故事抄錄下來或者用磁帶記錄。

sentences.english: Use I when you record or memorize sentences or words.
sentences.chinese: 抄錄和記憶句型與慣用語時，要用單數第一人稱。

sentences.english: In long shaky strokes Sargent copied the data.
sentences.chinese: 薩金特用長而顫巍巍的筆畫抄錄了數據。

sentences.english: I have reproduced the Curatorial records for both of the guns below.
sentences.chinese: 下面我抄錄了館內收藏員關於這些炮的紀錄。

sentences.english: This quotation is taken from a newspaper article.
sentences.chinese: 這段引文是從報上抄錄來的。

sentences.english: Copy this passage exactly as it stands.
sentences.chinese: 把這段文章完全照原樣抄錄下來。

sentences.english: The account of the trial was transcribed from the stenographer 's shorthand notes.
sentences.chinese: 這篇審判的報道是從速記員的筆記中抄錄而來的。

sentences.english: She loved the poet so much that she copied out his whole collection of poetry.
sentences.chinese: 她酷愛這位詩人，以致將他的詩集全抄錄下來。

definition: variant character/loan word/variant written form (for the same word)/different edition
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
to transcribe/to make a fair copy
to copy (a text) from person to person/(of a text) to be transmitted by copying
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
to annotate/to add marginal comments on/criticism/marginalia
